utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hey! I got you a present!!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh my goodness! Where did you hide it?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I got it for your wedding and I ordered it weeks ago, and it finally got here!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Pheebs you didn’t have to get us anything for our wedding you already sang…

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I love it! It’s huge!! Let’s open it! Open it!!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: It’s a Ms. Pac-Man machine!!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh my God!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I didn’t know where to put it so I just left it here for now.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh well, maybe we can put it in the guest bedroom.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh, okay.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: All right.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I kinda like it here.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Do you really like it?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Are you kidding?! I practically spent my entire childhood at the arcade! This is like—Oh my, this is like my second favorite game!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh really? What was your first?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Well I-I really don’t remember the name of it.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well what did it do?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Well, you just—you put a quarter in and y’know pull-pull some handles and win like a candy bar or something.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: A vending machine?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Don’t feel bad for me! I won like every time!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey! Oh, I’m so glad you guys are here. I’ve been dying to tell someone what happened in the Paleontology department today.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Do you think he saw us or can we still sneak out?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Professor Neuman, the head of the department, so….

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: They made you head of the department!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: No, I get to teach one of his advanced classes! Why didn’t I get head of the department?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh! Hey Rach, listen umm…

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I got a big date coming up, do you know a good restaurant?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Uh, Paul’s Café. They got great food and it’s really romantic.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Ooh, great! Thanks!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah! Oh, and then afterwards you can take her to the Four Seasons for drinks. Or you go downtown and listen to some jazz. Or dancing—Oh! Take her dancing!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: You sure are naming a lot of ways to postpone sex, I’ll tell ya…

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ooh, I miss dating. Gettin’ all dressed up and going to a fancy restaurant. I’m not gonna be able to do that for so long, and it’s so much fun! I mean not that sitting at home worrying about giving birth to a sixteen pound baby is not fun.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey, y’know what?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Huh?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Why don’t I take you out?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: What?! Joey, you don’t want to go on a date with a pregnant lady.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yes I do! And we’re gonna go out, we’re gonna have a good time, and take your mind off of child birth and c-sections and-and giant baby heads stretching out…

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay! I’ll go with ya! I’ll go! I’ll go with ya.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I’ll be fun.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: All right?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: No. No! Yes! Ahh. Oh, would you look at that Monica? I just knocked off all of your top scores, how sad.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay, I’m next. Don’t! Don’t start another game! I said I’m next! Phoebe!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh, I’m sorry. I didn’t hear you over all the winning.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Chandler! Phoebe’s hogging the game!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Who cares? It’s a stupid game.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: You only think it’s stupid because you suck at it.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I don’t suck. It’s sucks. You suck.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Wait okay, if this game is gonna cause problems between the two of you, then maybe I should just keep it.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: No! No-no! I love it! It is a great present! In fact, why don’t you go home and wait for the thank you card?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Why do you want to play this game so bad?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah! It’s not like it spits out a Clark bar after every game.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay. Phoebe that’s it. Come on, get out—out of the chair. Get out! Oh come…Phoebe!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Joey? Could you get that? What are you doing here? I thought you were in your room?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: No, I’m picking you up for our date. These are for you.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ohh, Lilies. Joey, they’re my favorite. Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: And, a brownie! Well, half a brownie. Actually, it’s just bag. It’s been a long walk from the flower shop and I was startin’ to feel faint so…

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh man! This is so great! I actually feel like I’m going on a real date! Although, I have a hint of morning sickness, and I’m wearing underwear that goes up to about……there.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey come on now, this is a real date. Uh, so…nice place you got here. Foosball, huh? Pizza box. Oh, a subscription to Playboy, my kind of woman.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah, actually that’s my roommate’s.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I would like to meet him. He sounds like a stand up guy.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ah yes, but he’s very protective of me so you’d better watch yourself.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Ah… Hey, so this roommate of yours…is he good looking?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hm-mmm.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh yeah, it must be tough to keep your hands of him, huh?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah, but I’m pretty sure he’s gay.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: No-no-no-no, he’s not! No! Why are you trying to ruin the game? Come on!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: …which brings us back of course to Greely’s theory of dominance. Okay, that-that’s all for today. Oh, uh does anyone know where the Freeman building is?

utterance.speaker: Student
utterance.content: Yeah, it’s the new building on Avenue A.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: What?! That-that’s all the way cross town, I’m supposed to teach a graduate seminar there in ten minutes.

utterance.speaker: Student
utterance.content: Ooh, dude. That’s not gonna happen.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Move it! Move it! Move it!! Hey!!! I’m the teacher!!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hello. I’m sorry I’m a little late. Ah——Whoa! A lot late. Let me start by uh, by introducing myself, I am Professor Geller. So to sum up, I’m Professor Geller. Good job today.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Now the filet mignon, what comes with that?

utterance.speaker: Waitress
utterance.content: There’s a side of steamed vegetables.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Emmm. Now, instead of the vegetables, is there anyway I can substitute the three-pound lobster?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Y’know what? Bring her both, and I’ll have the same.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Wow! This is shaping up to be a pretty good date—Oh, I almost forgot. I didn’t pay you the rent check.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh whoa-whoa-whoa, no roommate stuff. Okay? We’re on a date.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay. Wow! So I get to see what Joey Tribbiani is like on a date. So do you have any moves?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: No! No. Umm, just myself and if they don’t like me for— I’m sorry I couldn’t even get through that.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I knew it! I knew it. Come on tell me your moves.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh alright. Umm, well, okay, I usually start by having a bottle of wine sent to my table from a fan.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh my God. And that works?!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Well it does when you combine it with, "This is so embarrassing, I just want to have a normal life!"

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, you poor little famous man.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh okay, how about this one. I was gonna wait until the end of the night to kiss you, but you’re so beautiful…I don’t think I can.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh my God! Wow! That was fantastic, I almost leaned in. I really almost did!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Alright, so…so tell me one of your moves.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Alright. So where’d you grow up?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: That’s your move? Boy Rach, you’re lucky you’re hot.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Come on, just answer the question!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Queens.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: And so were-were you close to your parents?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah, with my mom. Yeah, not so much with my dad.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Why not?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I don’t know. I guess there’s just always been this distance y’know—I mean we both try to pretend it’s not there, but it is.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh. It’s gotta be rough.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah, it is. It’s really tough. Y’know sometimes I think—Wow!! Nice move!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Huh?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: "Where’d you grow up," it’s so simple!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Thank you! And now if you’ll excuse me, I have to go to the rest room.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: And now you’re watching me walk away.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yes I am! Again so simple!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: You are not going to believe what I did today!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Well it clearly wasn’t showering or shaving.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I got good. I played this game all day and now I rule at it! They should change the name of it to Ms. Chandler. Although I-I hope they don’t.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Wait a minute, you stayed home all day and played Ms. Pac-Man while I went off to work like some kind of chump?!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Uh-huh, and I got all the top ten scores, I erased Phoebe off the board! High five!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: What is the matter with your hand?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well I’ve been playing it for like eight hours, it’ll loosen up. Come on, check out the scores. Oh, and also look at the initials, they’re dirty words.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Chandler, why would you do that?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Because it’s awesome.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: You think this is clever?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well y’know, they only give you three letters, so after A-S-S it is a bit of a challenge.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hey wait a minute, this one isn’t dirty.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: It is when you put it together with that one.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Ah, well if you don’t clear this off, you won’t be getting one of those from me. But Ben’s coming over here tomorrow to play this game, this can’t be there.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Come on, he won’t even know what they mean.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Chandler! He’s seven; he’s not stupid.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Have you talked to him lately?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: All right, look I’m just gonna unplug it.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: No-no-no, if you unplug it, I’ll have nothing to show for my day! It would be like I was at work. No! Hey look at that! Look at that, it’s still there! This thing must have some kind of primitive ROM Chip in it or something!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Honey you-you got to beat your scores!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: With the claw?!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: All right fine. Fine, I’ll do it. I’ve just got to get this off the screen. Carol and Susan are still upset that you taught him pull my finger.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Pull my finger——My hand is messed up.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I am not gonna answer that!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh come on! Just pick one! Between Monica, Phoebe, Chandler, and Ross if you had to, if you had to, who would you punch?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No one! They are my friends, I wouldn’t punch any of them.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Chandler?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah, but I don’t know why. Look at me, I’m having such a wonderful time!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Me too! Hey Rach, can I just say I think this is the best date I ever had!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I know!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I never laughed so hard—Did you see the wine come out of my nose?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Joey, I think everyone saw the wine come out of your nose.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I gotta say, I never knew I could enjoy the non-sex part of the date so much.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well that is because you have never been on a date with me before.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Huh. Huh.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: All right, now don’t judge me. I normally wait until my date leaves, but you live here. I’m ripping into this swan.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Ah! Okay, well then you don’t judge me. I’m gonna suck on the cellophane from the brownie I had before.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: So tell me, what are Joey Tribbiani’s end of the night moves?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Ah, well, if I want the girl to kiss me, first thing I do is make my lips look irresistible.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: How do you do that?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Now you can’t tell anyone, but uh…I put on shiny lip balm.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh my God!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah, like a moth to a flame, I’m telling ya. Okay all right, so now you go.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No, I don’t want to tell you.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Why not?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Because it’s embarrassing.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: More embarrassing than shiny raspberry lip balm?! I didn’t say raspberry before did I? All right just-just tell me Rach, just tell me!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay. All right, stand up. Well, when we’re at the door, I lightly press my lips against his, and then move into his body just for a second, and then I make this sound, "Hmmm." Okay, I know it doesn’t sound like anything, but I swear it works.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah. Why—Yeah, that would work for ya…

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: All right, I gotta go to bed. Honey, I had such a wonderful time.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh. Yeah. Me to.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: …you were 50 minutes late to the class, what did you crawl there?!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: No, I ran. It was really far, and when did people stop understanding the phrase, "Get the hell out of my way!"

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well, why didn’t you just take a cab?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Ugh, between the traffic that time of day and all the one-way streets it’ll take me twice as long. Besides, I teach the class three times a week, who am I? Rockefeller?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well you’re not gonna be able to keep doing this.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Well I have too. Okay? If I don’t, they’ll take the class away from me. And…I already put it in my family newsletter.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: You what?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: You’ve seen it, the Geller Yeller.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Right. Wow!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Besides, I-I think I figured out a much faster route, I’m sure I can make it this time. I just…I just can’t be afraid to get a little bit…hit by cars.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hi! Hey, remember how last night we were talking about that movie Cujo?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh yeah, I still can’t believe you haven’t seen Cujo. What is wrong with you?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Relax! It’s not like it’s Citizen Kane!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Have you ever tried to sit through Citizen Kane?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah I know it’s really boring, but it’s like a big deal. Anyway, I was thinking about renting Cujo sometime.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh yeah? All right, let’s do it tonight.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well don’t you have that big date tonight?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh right!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hey Joey, can I ask you something?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: After our date last night, did you feel a little weird?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh my God! You did too? It totally freaked me out, what was that?!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I don’t know! I’m-I’m kinda thinking it-it was the lobster…

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh yeah-yeah, the lobster.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah, I mean I was up sick all night.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah me too, all night.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Really?! How come we didn’t cross paths?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah well that’s because uh…I stayed in my room. Yeah, you don’t want to look in my hamper.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay, I got that. I’ll escape over there. I’ll come back over here. All right, come on Ms. Pac-Man. It’s got—Right— Well, you’re just a little bitch, aren’t you?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hey, you guys. Listen, I’m sorry that I was hogging the game before——Oh my God! Your friends have some unfortunate initials!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: They’re all Chandler.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Chandler sucks! He couldn’t have gotten this good!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I did. But it came at a price.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: But Ben is coming over tonight and he can’t see this.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh come on, by age seven kids have already seen orgies. Was it just me?!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah!!!! Yes, I made it! I’m on time! Okay, why don’t we all uh, open our books to page 23. Where… Where you will see…a uh…a bunch of uh…red spots. Okay, umm, why don’t, why don’t you all start to read, while I—

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: No-no! I’m fine. It’s just… Hey, can I ask you something? Have you ever looked at someone that you’ve known for a while and then suddenly…suddenly see them a different way?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah. Yeah, that…that’s exactly it. You’re right. Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Ooh! Yeah. So yeah, so you know exactly what I’m talking about.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh yeah, sure. Ehhh.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh my God Phoebe, you’re on fire!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I know!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: One more score to go! You can do it!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Don’t touch me!!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Don’t touch her!!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: All right! Go left! Go left! Go right!! Go right!!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I can’t!! I can’t!! Noooooooo!!!!!!! You son of a bitch!!!!!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Phoebe!!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh hi Ben—No!! Don’t look at the machine!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh God! Thank God you’re home! I’m watching Cujo.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Alone?!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yes! But what is wrong with this dog?!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey, did you get to the part where they’re trapped in the car and Cujo’s throwin’ himself at the windshield?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No! No! Seriously, what’s wrong with the dog?! Wait a minute, what are you doing home so early? What happened to your date?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh uh, it didn’t work out.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh. Do you want to watch the rest of the movie with me?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh uh, okay. Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Y’know, I never thought I’d say this about a movie, but I really hope this dog dies. What are you doing over there? Come sit here, you protect me.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh sure, yeah, why not?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay. Okay, that’s him! That’s him! That’s Cujo! That’s Cujo!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: All right, I know! I know. Yeah, it’ll be okay.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh my God….What’s he gonna do now? I can’t watch! Oh. Seriously, how can you watch this? Aren’t you scared?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Terrified.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: So is everybody here? I got here a little early myself. Let us begin. Now, the hydrosaurids have been unearthed in two main locations. Here. Here. Now as for the hydrosaurs…
